term.title: electron acceptor

item.text: A substance to which an electron may be transferred; for example 1,4-dinitrobenzene or the dication 1,1'-dimethyl-4,4'-bipyridyldiium.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 1077. 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 1109 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466051077)

item.text: [obsolete] A Lewis acid. This usage is discouraged.

term.citation: Citation: 'electron acceptor' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.E01976

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
